results.title: Plan 9 from outer space = Grave robbers from outer space
results.creator_credit: Edward Wood Jr and Reynolds Pictures
results.brief_description: The local authorities join forces with the military to ward off an invasion of flying saucers. Undeterred, the aliens continue their attempt to conquer Earth by resurrecting corpses from a San Fernando cemetery. “Plan 9 from outer space” has been described as the worst film ever made. This dubious honour has led to the cult status and notoriety the film enjoys to this day, proving that any publicity is good publicity. Those who have seen Tim Burton’s homage, “Ed Wood”, will enjoy seeing this original masterpiece. Bela Lugosi played the definitive vampire as Count Dracula in Tod Browning’s 1931 classic horror. In “Plan 9”, he revives his ghoulish persona in this, his final screen role.

results.title: Plagued. Episodes 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, Aviva Ziegler, Deanne Edwards, Janet Bell, Channel Four, Film Australia and Goldwyn Associates
results.brief_description: Conceived, written and narrated by award winning medical broadcaster, Dr. Norman Swan, this four part series investigates the relationship between history, destiny and disease. “The Origins of disease” investigates, through various case studies, including Korean haemorrhagic fever, shell shock, RSI and heart disease, how new diseases arise. We also discover that some are not diseases at all, but suffering made worse by factors as diverse as medical jargon and management style. “Epidemics: products of progress” takes up the theme that, ironically, throughout history, epidemics have been the results of so-called progress, and that despite medical technology, we are still vulnerable to old and new diseases, such as plague, cholera and AIDS which have the power to change the course of history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Goldwyn, Aviva Ziegler, Deanne Edwards, Janet Bell, Channel Four, Film Australia and Goldwyn Associates

results.title: Placido: a year in the life of Placido Domingo
results.creator_credit: Revel Guest, Group W, Channel 4 and Transatlantic Films
results.brief_description: Documentary made for television portraying a year in the life of one of the greatest opera singers of our time, Placido Domingo. This charming and charismatic performer takes us on a journey around the world from the major opera houses such as the Royal Opera House Covent Garden and La Scala Milan, to the Metropolitan Opera House in New York. He also manages to include appearances on television shows with Carol Burnett in Los Angeles and Charles Aznavour in Paris. The film includes excerpts from his performances in Tosca, The Tales of Hoffmann, Ernani, Otello, La fanciulla del West, Manon Lescaut and the Zeffirelli film of La Traviata. Also features Dame Kiri te Kanawa in Die Fledermaus.

results.title: Pixillation
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Knowlton, Lillian Schwartz and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: An experiment in film art using computer graphics and music by the Moog synthesiser. Inventive combinations of colour, form and motion have been produced. Music by Gershon Kingsley; crystal growth and computer graphics by Bell Labs.

results.title: Pity me not = Without each other
results.creator_credit: Saul Swimmer, Allen Klein, III Task Pictures and PMN Productions
results.brief_description: A drama about circus life and those who are a part of the circus family - in particular, a young trapeze artist played by Tony Anthony. Cast also includes Brud Talbot, Anne Hegira, Michael Dunn, Bob White, Barbara Biggart, Ann Harris. Music composed and conducted by Dimitri Tiomkin.

results.title: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.creator_credit: Karen Hughes and Trikon Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. What she later experienced in her healing work is the subject of this extraordinary documentary. A multi-award winning production.

results.title: Listen up my cherubs!
results.creator_credit: Karen Milward, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Energetic and intelligent, Karen Milward is constantly engaged with life. Often on the road for her work in the Aboriginal community, her children wonder what it is she actually does. This story is by way of explanation and gives insight into the life of an amazing community worker and consultant.

results.title: I love my family
results.creator_credit: Amy Dowd, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Amy Dowd has grown up in a big family but she wouldn’t have it any other way. She introduces us to them all, serving as a loving tribute and memoir for generations to come.

results.title: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Karen Milward, Norman Terrick, Linda Kennedy-Baxter, Emily Yarram, Daphne Yarram, Bindie Jack, Bess Yarram, Ben Yarram, Barbara Tilley, Amy Dowd, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ten members of the Gippsland Indigenous community share their stories. The stories, while biographical in form, are mostly centred on the theme of family, of belonging in a community and how both these things contribute to a sense of identity.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
